blurb: You might be eligible for DACA! It stands for "Consideration of Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals". It's an immigration policy that allows certain undocumented immigrants in the United States to receive a renewable two-year work permit and exemption from deportation.

copy: If you are age 16 or over, you can apply for a NYS driver license. The first step is to apply for a learner permit at a DMV office.
You will need to take the following: 1) a written test, 2) an eye test, unless you bring an Eye Test Report (MV-619) completed by an eyecare professional

If you do not pass the written test, you can take it again for no additional fee. There is no limit to how many times you can take the written test.If you pass the written test, we will issue you a learner permit that is valid for approximately 5 years.
blurb: You must take a written test to receive your learner permit.  To pass the test, you must get least 14 of the 20 multiple-choice questions correct. This includes the correct answers to at least two of the four questions about road signs.

copy: Make a reservation online before visiting offices in New York City, Westchester, Nassau, Suffolk, Rockland, Onondaga or Albany Counties.

Bring the following documents to the DMV: 1) a completed Application for Permit, Driver License or Non-Driver ID Card (MV-44), 2) Social Security Card, 3) acceptable proof of identity and birth, and 4) payment for fees.
Congratulations! You must take a road test to obtain a drivers license.

To prepare for your road test, you must: 1) obey the learner permit restrictions on where and when you may drive, 2) complete a 5-hour Pre-licensing Course, 3) get an appropriate amount of supervised driving practice.
You may not drive unless accompanied by a supervising driver age 21 or older who has a valid license to operate the vehicle you are driving.

blurb: You may not drive with a learner permit on: 1) any street within a park in New York City, 2) any bridge or tunnel under the jurisdiction of the tri-borough Bridge and Tunel Authority, 3) the Cross Crountry, Hutchinson River, Saw Mill River, or Taconic State parkways in Westchester County, and 4) a DMV road test area. There are additional restrictions for learner permit holders under age 18.

copy: The course covers many important topics, including: 1) driving within the highway transportation system, 2) driver habits and skills, 3) feelings, attitudes and risk taking, 4) alcohol, other drugs and driving
blurb: It is a DMV-approved, standardized classroom course that provides knowledge that you will need as a new driver.

copy: If you complete a high school or college driver education course, you will receive a Driver Education Certificate (MV-285), and you do not need a Pre-licensing Course Certificate. You must have one of these certificates to schedule your road test.
blurb: The Pre-licensing Course is available through high schools, colleges, and many driving schools. To find providers in your area, look online or in your telephone directory for ‚ÄúDriving Instruction.‚Äù When you successfully complete the course, you will be given a Pre-licensing Course Certificate (MV-278).

copy: Before you take your read test, you must have a minimum of 50 hours of supervised practice driving with: 1) at least 15 hours at night (after sunset), and 2) at least 10 hours in moderate to heavy traffic.

blurb: If you are under age 18, your parent must complete Certification of Supervised Driving (MV-262) to certify that you have had the required hours of supervised practice driving.

copy: You must first schedule an appointment to take a road test.
3) provide your DMV ID Number from your Learner Permit and date of birth, 4) at least one unused test available, and 5) your ZIP code.
blurb: You must have the following to schedule a road test: 1) a valid New York State Learner Permit, 2) an original Pre-Licensing Course Certificate (MV-278) or a Driver Education Certificate (MV-285).

copy: 3) original Pre-Licensing Certificate or Driver Education Certificate, 4) a driver of age 21 or older who has a license valid to operate the test vehicle, 5) a vehicle to drive during the test that has a valid registration and inspection, operates properly and is in clean condition.
blurb: You must have all of the following: 1) your photo learner permit, 2) glasses or contacts, if your permit indicates you need corrective lenses

copy: The license examiner will give you an interim license that allows you to drive; keep the license with your photo learner permit. Allow 2 weeks to receive your photo driver license in the mail

If you fail a non-commercial license road test, your learner permit remains valid until the expiration date. You can schedule another road test, but you must: 1) pay additional fees if you failed your first two road tests, 2) wait at least until the day after your failed road test to schedule another test.

blurb: Visit Social Security Administration to receive a letter of ineligibility.
